title.narrative: 1.3 IMMUNIZATION

description.narrative: Output 1.3: By 2018, health facilities offer effective vaccination services using fixed (<5km), outreach (between 5 and 15 km) and mobile (>15 km) strategies to reach all children, including the hardest to reach as a result of geographical, cultural or other reasons. Equity-based approaches will be adopted, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Immunization, Polio Eradication. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Children under 5 years of age and pregnant women, particularly the most vulnerable, increasingly benefit from quality high-impact interventions for the prevention and management of maternal and childhood illnesses, including in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Measles and rubella supplementary immunization activities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.3: By 2018, health facilities offer effective vaccination services using fixed (<5km), outreach (between 5 and 15 km) and mobile (>15 km) strategies to reach all children, including the hardest to reach as a result of geographical, cultural or other reasons. Equity-based approaches will be adopted

description.narrative: In 2018, focus was put on increasing supply and quality of routine immunization especially through cold chain optimization including effective vaccine management. Furthermore, national guidelines for Reaching Every Child with Equity were developed and adopted. Polio outbreak response to vaccine derived outbreak is ongoing in 4 Regions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

title.narrative: Number of weeks of stockout of any vaccine at health district level in convergence municipalities
Planned supplemental implementation activities that were cancelled, postponed or reduced in size, during the previous 6 months due to gaps in vaccine supply
Effective vaccine management (EVM) composite country score
% of health districts in convergence municipalities having less than three confirmed cases of measles
Months with stockout of measles vaccine at the national level (Target: 0 month)
% of activities in the Effective Vaccine Management (EVM) improvement plan implemented

Number of supplementary polio activities vaccination cancelled, posponed, or reduce during the prior six month as the results of vaccine shortage out of the total number of avtivities planned for the last six months
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) IPV introduced into routine immunization schedules and country switched from trivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (tOPV) to bivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (bOPV)
Analysis of "Equity in Immunisation" has been conducted and corrective actions are identified
Country had no stock-out of DTP/Penta, Polio (OPV and IPV) and Tetanus Toxoid vaccines at district level
Existence of a Multi-Year Plan (MYP) for immunisation
